value.0: Long gashes run diagonally across this ghost's torso and his throat is a large and gaping wound. It is hard to tell if his skin bore the same gray cast in life as it does now in death.

He points to the adjacent bridge where an elkenbeast stands, its white coat melding with the grayer mist. He then raises his finger upwards to where the Land of Living, of life and light, must still exist.
The spirit gestures apologetically towards its ragged throat. Whatever killed him tore out his jugular and, in so doing, took his voicebox too.
The man nods excitedly. He leans closer to you, the air around him crackling with an unearthly chill. He seems be waiting for you to tell him something.
He seems crestfallen. His fleshy hand reaches for yours, his frail handshake cold and clammy.
The air around you grows colder with the ghost's anticipation of your next words. You get the sense that his entire existence hinges on them somehow.
The ghostly man smiles as he nods at you in gratitude. He seems finally to be at peace. Slowly his figure fades from view, becoming nothing more than mist.

The spark seems to die in the ghostly eyes before you. He snaps his quarterstaff against his knee and throws the pieces from the bridge. In a rage, he dives after them, flailing into the darkness below.
The ghostly figure nods but seems unsatisfied, as if he had been hoping for news of something else.
"Goodbye."
"There be any way me can help?"
"Is there any way I can help?"
"What happen to you?"
"What happened to you?"
"Who you be?"
"Who are you?"
"You be brother of Bernhardt Huntersfeldt?"
"Are you the brother of Bernhardt Huntersfeldt?"
"Sorry. Me not know what you want me to say."
"I'm sorry, I don't know what you want me to say."
"He tell me 'bout how crag cat get you."
"He told me about the crag cat that killed you."
"Bernhardt say it survive winter and find mate."
"Bernhardt says it survived the winter and found a mate."
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> "He hunt it down and kill it for vengeance."
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> "He hunted it down and killed it to avenge you."
"He still tend Elkenbeast herd for Clan."
"He's still tending the Clan's Elkenbeast herd."
